metadata.title: CVE-2024-41149 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:block: avoid to reuse `hctx` not removed from cpuhp callback listIf the 'hctx' isn't removed from cpuhp callback list, we can't reuse it,otherwise use-after-free may be triggered.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-41149` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-generic - 3.13.0-173.224
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-lowlatency - 3.13.0-173.224
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1054.58
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1180-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro
